thread.title: Prosecutors Say Long Island Corruption Case Started With $3000 Chair

author: Joseph De Avila
title: Prosecutors Say Long Island Corruption Case Started With $3000 Chair
text:
CENTRAL ISLIP, N.Y.—Federal prosecutors say a corrupt relationship between former Nassau County Executive Edward Mangano and restaurateur Harendra Singh began with a $3,000 office chair.
In 2010, Mr. Mangano printed a picture of the chair off a website and handed it to Mr. Singh, his friend of over 20 years, prosecutors said at the opening of a trial in U.S. District Court here Wednesday. Mr. Singh then bought him the chair and over years paid for hardwood floors for Mr. Mangano’s home, a $7,300 watch and vacations to places... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
